entry.title: SAP CPQ - Make your beautiful Christmas Theme in your tenant
entry.content:
The holiday season is here, and what better way to spread festive cheer than by giving your SAP CPQ tenant a beautiful Christmas makeover? A themed interface not only adds a touch of joy but also creates a delightful experience for your users during this special time of year.

Why Customize Your SAP CPQ Theme?

SAP CPQ offers flexible branding options that allow you to personalize the look and feel of your tenant. By applying a Christmas theme, you can:

  • Enhance user engagement with a festive interface.
  • Reflect your company‚Äôs holiday spirit.
  • Create a memorable experience for customers and internal teams.

Steps to Create a Christmas Theme in SAP CPQ

1. Access Branding Settings

Navigate to Setup ‚Üí Administration ‚Üí UI Design‚ÜíBranding in your SAP CPQ tenant. This is where you can customize with your style sheet

/* --- Header Background Styling --- */
.christmas-theme {
    /* Set a dark background if desired, or keep original. */
    /* background-color: #0d1a26; */ 
    position: relative; /* Essential for positioning lights and snow */
    overflow: hidden; /* Important to keep snow/lights contained */
}

/* --- Christmas Lights Container --- */
.christmas-lights {
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
    width: 100%;
    height: 20px; /* Adjust height for visibility */
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-around; /* Distribute lights evenly */
    align-items: center;
    pointer-events: none; /* Allows clicks to pass through */
    z-index: 10; /* Make sure lights are on top of the header background */
}

/* --- Light Bulb Styling --- */
.light-bulb {
    width: 11px;
    height: 15px;
    border-radius: 50% / 80% 80% 20% 20%; /* Bulb shape */
    box-shadow: 0 0 5px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7);
    animation: blink 1s infinite alternate; /* Simple blinking animation */
    position: relative;
    margin: 0 5px; /* Spacing between bulbs */
}

/* Add a "wire" to the bulb */
.light-bulb::before {
    content: '';
    position: absolute;
    top: -5px; /* Position above the bulb */
    left: 50%;
    transform: translateX(-50%);
    width: 5px;
    height: 5px;
    background-color: #333; /* Dark color for the wire */
}

/* --- Color Variations and Light Glow --- */
.light-bulb.red {
    background-color: #ff0000;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px 3px #ff0000;
}
.light-bulb.green {
    background-color: #94BF31;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px 3px #94BF31;
    animation-delay: 0.3s; /* Offset for blinking effect */
}
.light-bulb.gold {
    background-color: #00ff34;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px 3px #00ff34;
    animation-delay: 0.6s; /* Offset for blinking effect */
}
.light-bulb.purple {
    background-color: #FF00FF;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px 3px #FF00FF;
    animation-delay: 0.6s; /* Offset for blinking effect */
}
.light-bulb.blue {
    background-color: #0000FF;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px 3px #0000FF;
    animation-delay: 0.6s; /* Offset for blinking effect */
}
.light-bulb.pink {
    background-color: #ff347b;
    box-shadow: 0 0 10px 3px #ff347b;
    animation-delay: 0.6s; /* Offset for blinking effect */
}

/* Blinking Animation */
@keyframes blink {
    from { opacity: 1; }
    to { opacity: 0.5; }
}

/* --- Snowfall Effect Container --- */
.snowfall-effect {
    position: absolute;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    pointer-events: none;
    background-image: radial-gradient(white 1px, transparent 0),
                      radial-gradient(white 2px, transparent 0),
                      radial-gradient(white 3px, transparent 0);
    background-size: 50px 50px, 70px 70px, 90px 90px;
    animation: snowfall 10s linear infinite; /* Animation to move the snow down */
    z-index: 5; /* Below the lights */
}

/* Snowfall Animation */
@keyframes snowfall {
    from { background-position: 0 0, 0 0, 0 0; }
    to { background-position: 500px 500px, 500px 500px, 500px 500px; }
}

Navigate to Setup‚ÜíAdministration ‚Üí UI Design‚ÜíResponsive Template in your SAP CPQ tenant. This is where you can customize with your knockoutJS template

@using WebSite.Controllers
<header role="banner">
    @*don't show header if user doesn't want menu (e.g. user came from mobile)*@
    <div id="headerContainer" class="row cald_header_bar hidden" data-bind="css: {'hidden': shouldHideMenu, 'wrap-when-landing-C4C': !landedFromC4C }">
        	<div class="row sap_header_bar flex flex-between">
            <div class="cald_header_section">
                <h1 class="cald_logo">@Translation.Get("MainMenu.MainHeading")</h1>
            </div>
            <div class="cald_header_section-right sap_header_section-right">
                <nav role="navigation" class="shellbar-navigation" aria-label="Primary Navigation">
                    <ul class="nav flex">
                        <li class="shellbar-navigation-item hidden" data-bind="css: { hidden : isElectronicallyGuestLoggedIn }"><a aria-label="@Translation.GetJS("quotation.ProposalMain.NewProject")" href="#" data-bind="click: createNewCart, tooltip: { title: '@Translation.GetJS("quotation.ProposalMain.NewProject")', placement: 'left', viewport: 'header' }" class="fiori3-create-new-quote-icon create-new-quote-icon nav-menu-icon"></a></li>
                        @Html.PartialWithNameAsComment("RecentlyVisitedObjects")
                        @Html.PartialWithNameAsComment("CartSummary", true)
                        <li id="cpq-companion" data-bind="css: { hidden : !isEnabledSapCompanionFunctionality }"><a aria-label="@Translation.GetJS("Header.Companion.Notifications")" href="#" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.GetJS("Header.Companion.Notifications")', placement: 'left', viewport: 'header' }" class="nav-menu-icon cpq-notifications-icon-style"></a></li>
                        @*show user menu*@
                        @*Show user menu only if user is not guest user nor electronically signed guest user*@
                        @Html.PartialWithNameAsComment("UserMenu")
                    </ul>
                </nav>
            </div>
        </div>
        <div>
            <button type="button" class="navbar-toggle pull-left" data-toggle="collapse" data-target=".navbar-collapse1">
                <span class="icon-bar"></span>
                <span class="icon-bar"></span>
                <span class="icon-bar"></span>
            </button>
        </div>
        <div class="visible-xs logo-container">
            <div class="cald_logo no-margin"></div>
        </div>
        <!-- /.navbar-collapse -->
    </div>
            <div class="christmas-lights">
                <div class="light-bulb red"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb green"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb blue"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb purple"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb gold"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb pink"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb red"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb green"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb gold"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb blue"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb purple"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb red"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb pink"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb green"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb gold"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb blue"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb purple"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb blue"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb red"></div>
                <div class="light-bulb pink"></div>
            </div>
        <div class="snowfall-effect"></div>    
    <div id="topMenuC4C" class="hidden" data-bind="css: { hidden : !landedFromC4C }">
        <ul>
            <li class="main-list-item hidden @(@ViewBag.CurrentPage == "Catalog" ? "active" : "")" data-bind="css: {'hidden': landedFromC4C && !isQuoteLoaded}">
                <a href="/Catalogue/CategoryTree.aspx" class="sap-icon full-width" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.GetJS("View.ResponsiveLayout.Catalog")', placement: 'left', viewport: 'header' }">
                    
                </a>
            </li>
            <li class="main-list-item" data-bind="css: { active: document.location.pathname == '/quotation/BulkValidation.aspx', 'hidden': !bulkValidationShow || useNewQuoteEngine }">
                <a href="/quotation/BulkValidation.aspx" class="sap-icon full-width" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.GetJS("BulkValidation.Title")', placement: 'left', viewport: 'header' }">
                    
                </a>
            </li>
            <!-- ko if: isQuoteEnvironmentExists()-->
            @Html.PartialWithNameAsComment("CartSummary", false) @*don't show user menu*@
            <!-- /ko -->
            <li class="main-list-item">
                <a class="dropdown-toggle sap-icon full-width" data-toggle="dropdown" href="#" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.GetJS("Menu.Setup")', placement: 'left', viewport: 'header' }"></a>
                <ul class="left slide-out-section dropdown-menu slide-down side-menu-expanded-section setup-menu-dropdown-c4c" role="menu">
                    <li class="hidden" data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isSetupLinkVisible(), css: { hidden : !tryIsAdmin }">
                        <a href="/admin/AdminTransfer.aspx?Log=1">
                            @Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")
                        </a>
                    </li>
                    <li class="hidden" data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isDevelopConsoleLinkVisible(), css: { hidden : !tryIsAdmin }">
                        <a href="/DeveloperConsole" target="_blank">
                            @Translation.Get("Menu.DeveloperConsole")
                        </a>
                    </li>
                    <li class="hidden" data-bind="click: clearSessionStorageOnButtonClick, css: { hidden : !tryIsAdmin }"><a href="/multiusers/UserPersonalizationPage.aspx">@Translation.Get("Default.master.UserPage")</a></li>
                    <li class="hidden" data-bind="css: { hidden : !tryIsAdmin }"><a href="/multiusers/QuoteLayout.aspx">@Translation.Get("multiusers.QuoteLayout")</a></li>
                    <li class="hidden" data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isEventLogLinkVisible(), css: { hidden : !tryIsAdmin }">
                        <a href="/SetupSpa/developer-tools/event-log" target="_blank">@Translation.Get("xmlEventLog")</a>
                    </li>
                    <li class="hidden" data-bind="click: clearSessionStorageOnButtonClick, css: { hidden : tryIsAdmin }"><a href="/multiusers/UserPersonalizationPage.aspx">@Translation.Get("Default.master.UserPage")</a></li>
                    <li class="hidden" data-bind="css: { hidden : tryIsAdmin }"><a href="/multiusers/QuoteLayout.aspx">@Translation.Get("multiusers.QuoteLayout")</a></li>
                </ul>
            </li>

        </ul>
    </div>
</header>
<div id="sideMenuContainer" data-bind="visible: isInitialized, css: (!landedFromC4C ? '' : 'd-none')" style="display: none">
    @*Show standard menu only if user is not guest user nor electronically signed guest user*@
    <div class="nav hidden" role="navigation" aria-label="Sidemenu Navigation" data-bind="css: { hidden : isGuestUserLoggedIn || isElectronicallyGuestLoggedIn || shouldHideOptions }">
        <ul class="nav cpq-scroll">
            <li class="side-menu-main-icon clearfix full-width" data-bind="css: { active: document.location.pathname == '/quotation/LoadQuote.aspx' || document.location.pathname == '/QuoteList' }">
                <a id="sideMenuLoadQuoteLink" href="/quotation/LoadQuote.aspx" class="sap-icon full-width" aria-label="@Translation.Get("quotation.ProposalMain.Existing")" data-bind="click: clearSessionStorageOnButtonClick, tooltip: { title: '@Translation.Get("quotation.ProposalMain.Existing")', placement: 'right', viewport: '#sideMenuContainer' }">
                    
                    <span class="left slide-out-section side-menu-expanded-section">
                        <span class="expanded-sidemenu-item" data-bind="visible: isSideMenuExpanded()">@Translation.Get("quotation.ProposalMain.Existing")</span>
                    </span>
                </a>
            </li>
            <li class="side-menu-main-icon clearfix full-width bulk-validation-side-menu-main-icon hidden" data-bind="css: { active: document.location.pathname == '/quotation/BulkValidation.aspx', 'hidden' : !bulkValidationShow || useNewQuoteEngine }">
                <a href="/quotation/BulkValidation.aspx" class="sap-icon full-width" aria-label="@Translation.Get("BulkValidation.Title")" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.Get("BulkValidation.Title")', placement: 'right', viewport: '#sideMenuContainer' }">
                    
                    <span class="left slide-out-section side-menu-expanded-section">
                        <span class="expanded-sidemenu-item bulk-validation-list-header" data-bind="visible: isSideMenuExpanded()">@Translation.Get("BulkValidation.Title")</span>
                    </span>
                </a>
            </li>
            @IF (AssetsController.HasVisibleColumns())
            {
                <!-- ko if: !useNewQuoteEngine -->
                    <li class="side-menu-main-icon clearfix full-width" data-bind="css: { active: document.location.pathname == '/Assets' }">
                        <a href="/Assets" class="sap-icon full-width" aria-label="@Translation.Get("quotation.Assets")" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.Get("quotation.Assets")', placement: 'right', viewport: '#sideMenuContainer' }">
                            
                            <span class="left slide-out-section side-menu-expanded-section">
                                <span class="expanded-sidemenu-item" data-bind="visible: isSideMenuExpanded()">@Translation.Get("quotation.Assets")</span>
                            </span>
                        </a>
                    </li>
                <!-- /ko -->
            }
            <li class="side-menu-main-icon clearfix full-width @(@ViewBag.CurrentPage == "Catalog" ? "active" : "")">
                <a id="CatalogId" href="/Catalogue/CategoryTree.aspx" class="sap-icon full-width" aria-label="@Translation.Get("View.ResponsiveLayout.Catalog")" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.Get("View.ResponsiveLayout.Catalog")', placement: 'right', viewport: '#sideMenuContainer' }">
                    
                    <span class="left slide-out-section side-menu-expanded-section">
                        <span class="expanded-sidemenu-item" data-bind="visible: isSideMenuExpanded()">@Translation.Get("View.ResponsiveLayout.Catalog")</span>
                    </span>
                </a>
            </li>
            @IF (@ApprovalsController.GetParsedCPQTagValue(ApproveQuotesVisibilityCondition))
            {
                <li class="side-menu-main-icon clearfix full-width @(@ViewBag.CurrentPage == "Approvals" ? "active" : "")">
                    <a id="sideMenuLoadQuoteForApprovalsLink" href="/quotation/LoadQuote.aspx?tab=2" class="sap-icon full-width" aria-label="@Translation.Get("View.ResponsiveLayout.Approvals")" data-bind="click: clearSessionStorageOnButtonClick, tooltip: { title: '@Translation.Get("View.ResponsiveLayout.Approvals")', placement: 'right', viewport: '#sideMenuContainer' }">
                        
                        <span class="left slide-out-section side-menu-expanded-section">
                            <span class="expanded-sidemenu-item" data-bind="visible: isSideMenuExpanded()">@Translation.Get("View.ResponsiveLayout.Approvals")</span>
                        </span>
                    </a>
                </li>
            }
            
            <li id="setupMenu" class="side-menu-main-icon hidden" data-bind="css: { hidden : !tryIsAdmin }, visible: setupLinksVisibility.isSetupLinkVisible() || setupLinksVisibility.isDevelopConsoleLinkVisible() || setupLinksVisibility.isScriptWorkbenchLinkVisible() || setupLinksVisibility.isEventLogLinkVisible()" style="display: none;">
                <button id="setupMenuDropdownTrigger" class="dropdown-toggle sap-icon" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-label="@Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")" data-bind="tooltip: { title: '@Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")', placement: 'right', viewport: '#sideMenuContainer' }, attr: { tabindex: isSideMenuExpanded() ? '-1' : '0'}" aria-expanded="false"></button>
                <ul id="setupMenuDropdownContainer" class="left slide-out-section dropdown-menu slide-in-from-left side-menu-expanded-section" role="menu">
                    <li class="list-header dropdown-menu-list-header">
                        @Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")
                        <span tabindex="0" aria-label="@Translation.GetJS("MainMenu.ToggleSetup")" data-bind="click: toggleSetupMenuItems, executeOnEnter: toggleSetupMenuItems, visible: isSideMenuExpanded(), tooltip: { title: '@Translation.GetJS("MainMenu.ToggleSetup")', placement: 'auto top' }" class="sap-icon setup-menu-items-toggle"></span>
                    </li>
                    <li data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isSetupLinkVisible(), css: { 'rolled-up-menu-item': areSetupMenuItemsRolledUp() }" role="menuitem">
                        <a href="/admin/AdminTransfer.aspx?Log=1" data-bind="click: clearSessionStorageOnButtonClick">
                            <span class="invisible-when-menu-expanded"></span> @Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")
                        </a>
                    </li>
                    <li data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isDevelopConsoleLinkVisible(), css: { 'rolled-up-menu-item': areSetupMenuItemsRolledUp() }" role="menuitem">
                        <a href="/DeveloperConsole" target="_blank">
                            <span class="invisible-when-menu-expanded"></span> @Translation.Get("Menu.DeveloperConsole")
                        </a>
                    </li>
                    <li data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isScriptWorkbenchLinkVisible(), css: { 'rolled-up-menu-item': areSetupMenuItemsRolledUp() }" role="menuitem">
                        <a id="ScriptWorkbenchId" data-bind="attr: { href: scriptWorkbenchHref }" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                            <span class="invisible-when-menu-expanded"></span> @Translation.Get("Menu.ScriptWorkbench")
                        </a>
                    </li>
                    <li data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isEventLogLinkVisible(), css: { 'rolled-up-menu-item': areSetupMenuItemsRolledUp() }" role="menuitem">
                        <a href="/SetupSpa/developer-tools/event-log" target="_blank">
                            <span class="invisible-when-menu-expanded"></span> @Translation.Get("xmlEventLog")
                        </a>
                    </li>
                </ul>
            </li>
            <li id="setupMenu" class="side-menu-main-icon hidden" data-bind="css: { hidden : !tryIsImpersonated || tryIsAdmin }">
                <a id="setupMenuDropdownTrigger" class="dropdown-toggle sap-icon" data-toggle="dropdown" href="#" aria-label="@Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")" title="@Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")"></a>
                <ul id="setupMenuDropdownContainer" class="left slide-out-section dropdown-menu slide-in-from-left side-menu-expanded-section" role="menu">
                    <li class="list-header dropdown-menu-list-header">
                        @Translation.Get("Menu.Setup")
                        <span data-bind="click: toggleSetupMenuItems, visible: isSideMenuExpanded()" class="sap-icon setup-menu-items-toggle"></span>
                    </li>
                    <li data-bind="if: setupLinksVisibility.isDevelopConsoleLinkVisible(), css: { 'rolled-up-menu-item': areSetupMenuItemsRolledUp() }" role="menuitem">
                        <a href="/DeveloperConsole" target="_blank">
                            <span class="invisible-when-menu-expanded"></span> @Translation.Get("Menu.DeveloperConsole")
                        </a>
                    </li>
                </ul>
            </li>
        </ul>
    </div>
    <a href="#" id="sidemenuToggle" class="side-menu-toggle rotated-side-menu-toggle" aria-label="@Translation.GetJS("MainMenu.ToggleMenu")" data-bind="click: toggleSideMenu, tooltip: { title: '@Translation.GetJS("MainMenu.ToggleMenu")', placement: 'auto left' }" aria-expanded="false"></a>
</div>
<script>
    $('.side-menu-toggle').click(function () {
        $("#wrap").toggleClass("side-menu-expanded");
        $('.side-menu-toggle').toggleClass('rotated-side-menu-toggle');

        // trigger tabdrop update on expanding/collapsing menu on quote pages
        if (document.location.pathname.indexOf('/quotation/') !== -1) {
            // timeout because of sidemenu animation
            setTimeout(function () {
                $(window).resize();
            }, 550)
        }
    });

    $('.list-header .sap-icon').click(function (event) {
        event.target.classList.toggle('rotated');
    });

    $('.list-header .sap-icon').on('keydown', function (event) {
        if (event.keyCode === 13) {
            event.target.classList.toggle('rotated');
        };
    });

    function encodeQueryStringParameter (key, value) {
        return encodeURIComponent(key) + '=' + encodeURIComponent(value);
    }

    $('#CatalogId').on('click', function (event) {
        var quoteId = sessionStorage.getItem("quoteId");

        if (quoteId && !isNaN(quoteId)) {
            var currentHref = $(this).attr('href');

            if (currentHref.endsWith("Catalogue/CategoryTree.aspx") != -1) {
                if (!currentHref.includes("quoteId")) {
                    var newHref = currentHref + "?" + encodeQueryStringParameter('quoteId', quoteId);
                    $(this).attr('href', newHref);
                }
            }
        }
    });
</script>

Pro Tips

  • Keep it professional: Avoid overly flashy designs that may distract users.
  • Maintain accessibility: Ensure color contrast meets accessibility standards.
  • Schedule a revert: Plan to switch back to your standard theme after the holidays.

Spread the Joy!

A Christmas-themed SAP CPQ tenant is a simple yet effective way to celebrate the season with your team and customers. So, go ahead‚Äîadd some sparkle to your CPQ experience and make this holiday season unforgettable!

entry.title: Re: Cash Management feature comparison: License types and...
entry.content:
Dear @byd,

Question 1

Scope Items = What functionality is switched on

In Public Cloud, Scope Items are the best-practice process building blocks you select during scoping in SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC)

More details below:

https://community.sap.com/t5/financial-management-q-a/how-do-i-know-if-sap-cash-management-is-activated/qaq-p/14123735

License Bundles (Finance Base / Premium) = What you paid for / are entitled to run

SAP commercial Finance Base and Finance Premium bundles are broad packages. Importantly, both bundles include cash, liquidity and working capital management at the package level Premium is all Base + additional capabilities

SAP also treats SAP S/4HANA Cloud for cash management as a separately licensable product capability/add-on that is provisioned in the tenant but requires entitlement

More details below:

https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center/certification-compliance/sap-s-4hana-cloud--public-edition-cloud-security-assessment--csa.html

Summary:

  • Basic Cash Management is typically the core/basic scope items (BFA/BFB) that most customers can activate with core Finance
  • Full/advanced cash management is tied to advanced scope items (J77/J78) and specific advanced features that SAP flags as requiring the cash management add-on/license

 

Question 2

SAP scope items are 3 characters (often letters+digits), not always 3-digit

Basic Cash Management (core/basic scope):

  • BFA ‚Äì Basic Bank Account Management
  • BFB ‚Äì Basic Cash Operations

Public Cloud for Cash Management (full/advanced scope):

  • J77 ‚Äì Advanced Bank Account Management
  • J78 ‚Äì Advanced Cash Operations

Other scope items commonly associated with Cash Management scenarios:

  • 2O0 Bank Fee Management
  • 2U8 Intercompany Process for Cash Concentration
  • 34P Treasury Workstation Cash Integration
  • 3L5 Liquidity Planning
  • 1MV Cash Application Integration (automation/ML for matching)

More details below:

https://community.sap.com/t5/financial-management-q-a/how-do-i-know-if-sap-cash-management-is-activated/qaq-p/14123735

SAP does not publish a universally reliable Finance Base exact scope item list mapping, because entitlement can depend on contract, add-ons, and activation. The most defensible mapping and what you can verify quickly in your tenant is:

  • Finance Base: you can usually activate BFA + BFB scopes
  • Finance Premium: includes everything in Base cash scope doesn‚Äôt automatically change unless you also have the cash management add-on entitlement and activate J77/J78

Question 3

Basic Cash Management (core/basic scope):

  • Bank statement processing (import/manual), memo records, cash reports, cash tools
  • Cash reporting via apps like Cash Flow Analyzer / Cash Position Analysis as part of basic operations

Typical limitation example some Cash Flow Analyzer selection capabilities are restricted in basic scope SAP explicitly notes certain interval-selection combinations are only supported when Advanced Cash Management (J78) is active

 

 

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3285568

Public Cloud for Cash Management (full/advanced scope):

In Public Cloud 2508 Feature Scope Description, SAP describes advanced daily cash manager activities such as

  • Monitoring actual + forecast cash positions
  • Tracking cash flow items across invoices, payments, bank statements, memo records, etc.
  • Bank transfers (initiate + monitor, templates)
  • Cash pooling (create/remove pools for concentration)
  • Payment approvals (approve/reject outgoing payments)
  • Cash flow reconciliation (reconcile intraday memo vs forecast)

and in Liquidity Management, SAP lists Cash flow analysis and forecast with:

  • analysis of historical cash flows with dimensions
  • forecasting with flexible dimensions (bank, country/region, company code)
  • ML-supported liquidity item adjustment

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP IAS Admin Console
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

What would be the best way to secure the SAP IAS Administration Console?

Is it a good idea to restrict access to a specific IP range (e.g. only the company network)? I‚Äôm concerned about locking myself out in case the IP address changes.

entry.title: Re: Como solucionar No task List Selected IW322
entry.content: Hi Ziri16, the IW322 error usually happens when the system doesn‚Äôt correctly link the maintenance order to the task list. Double-check that the new task list is properly assigned in the maintenance plan and that the assignment indicator is active. Sometimes deleting or flagging the old task list isn‚Äôt enough ‚Äî you may need to refresh or reassign the task list in the order itself. Also, make sure all relevant dates and plant/location data match between the order and task list.

entry.title: Modern Finance Data Modeling in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
ùóôùóøùóºùó∫ ùó°ùòÇùó∫ùóØùó≤ùóøùòÄ ùòÅùóº ùóúùóªùòÄùó∂ùó¥ùóµùòÅùòÄ: ùóõùóºùòÑ ùó†ùóºùó±ùó≤ùóøùóª ùóôùó∂ùóªùóÆùóªùó∞ùó≤ ùóßùó≤ùóÆùó∫ùòÄ ùóîùóøùó≤ ùó•ùó≤ùóØùòÇùó∂ùóπùó±ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóßùóµùó≤ùó∂ùóø ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ ùóôùóºùòÇùóªùó±ùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóªùòÄ ùó∂ùóª ùüÆùü¨ùüÆùü± ùòÑùó∂ùòÅùóµ ùó¶ùóîùó£ ùó¶/ùü∞ùóõùóîùó°ùóî.

Insights from real customer transformations across Manufacturing, Retail, Life Sciences, semiconductor, High Tech, Professional Services, etc.

üíéùóßùóµùó≤ ùó°ùó≤ùòÑ ùóôùó∂ùóªùóÆùóªùó∞ùó≤ ùóòùòÖùóΩùó≤ùó∞ùòÅùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª

Across every customer I‚Äôve worked with recently ‚Äî from global manufacturing to high-tech subscription businesses ‚Äî CFOs consistently ask for:

‚Ä¢ One reliable version of financial truth

‚Ä¢ Visibility across SAP + non-SAP systems

‚Ä¢ Standard KPIs across entities and geographies

‚Ä¢ Real-time insights instead of month-end surprises

Today, finance is expected to be predictive, not reactive.

üíéùó™ùóµùóÆùòÅ ùóú‚Äôùó∫ ùó¢ùóØùòÄùó≤ùóøùòÉùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóîùó∞ùóøùóºùòÄùòÄ ùóñùóπùó∂ùó≤ùóªùòÅùòÄ

In my recent engagements, one theme stands out:

Finance struggles because data is scattered, inconsistent, and interpreted differently across teams.

Common patterns I see:

‚Ä¢ Different COA structures across regions

‚Ä¢ Customer, product, and subscription master data not harmonized

‚Ä¢ Reporting teams spending 60‚Äì70% of time reconciling instead of analyzing

‚Ä¢ Heavy dependency on spreadsheets despite having S/4HANA

‚Ä¢ This is why a structured data journey is becoming essential.

üíéùóßùóµùó≤ ùóòùóªùó±-ùòÅùóº-ùóòùóªùó± ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ ùóùùóºùòÇùóøùóªùó≤ùòÜ (ùó™ùóµùóÆùòÅ ùó™ùóºùóøùó∏ùòÄ ùó∂ùóª ùó•ùó≤ùóÆùóπ ùó£ùóøùóºùó∑ùó≤ùó∞ùòÅùòÄ)

When finance data is consistently organized through the full lifecycle, reporting quality transforms.

The framework I see succeeding from SAP Standpoint:

‚Ä¢ Clean master data (MDG or equivalent workflows)

‚Ä¢ Unified data models in Datasphere

‚Ä¢ Standard definitions and KPIs using Business Data Cloud

‚Ä¢ Enterprise-wide analytics in SAC or hybrid BI models

‚Ä¢ Predictive insights to leadership

This creates the foundations for trustworthy financial reporting.

üíéùó¶ùóîùó£‚ÄôùòÄ ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ ùóôùóÆùóØùóøùó∂ùó∞: ùó¶ùòÅùóøùóºùóªùó¥ ùó≥ùóºùóø ùó¶ùóîùó£-ùóñùó≤ùóªùòÅùóøùó∂ùó∞ ùóüùóÆùóªùó±ùòÄùó∞ùóÆùóΩùó≤ùòÄ

Across customers with deep SAP footprints, the SAP-native fabric delivers huge value:

üî∑MDG ‚Üí Golden records

üî∑Datasphere ‚Üí Unified SAP data layer

üî∑Business Data Cloud ‚Üí Harmonized business definitions

üî∑SAC ‚Üí Real-time dashboards & planning

ùó™ùóµùóÆùòÅ ùóú‚ÄôùòÉùó≤ ùòÄùó≤ùó≤ùóª:

When most critical processes run on SAP, this stack gives unmatched semantic accuracy.

 

üíéùóïùòÇùòÅ ùó°ùóºùòÅ ùóòùòÉùó≤ùóøùòÜ ùóñùòÇùòÄùòÅùóºùó∫ùó≤ùóø ùó¶ùòÅùóÆùòÜùòÄ ùü≠ùü¨ùü¨% ùó¶ùóîùó£

In several recent projects, customers chose Snowflake, Databricks, Collibra, or Informatica alongside SAP‚Äîeven when they run S/4HANA.Based on my experience, they do this when: 

‚ú® Non-SAP data forms a big part of revenue, operations, or customer analytics

‚ú®AI/ML workloads need hyperscaler scale

‚ú®Data storage must be low-cost (S3/ADLS)

‚ú®The enterprise already standardized on Collibra or Alation

‚ú®IoT or product telemetry flows in at petabyte scale

In these cases, SAP data is incredibly important ‚Äî but sits inside a broader enterprise ecosystem.

 

üíéùó™ùóµùóÆùòÅ ùóú‚Äôùó∫ ùó¶ùó≤ùó≤ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó™ùóºùóøùó∏ ùóïùó≤ùòÄùòÅ: ùóõùòÜùóØùóøùó∂ùó± ùóóùóÆùòÅùóÆ ùóôùóÆùóØùóøùó∂ùó∞

The most successful clients follow a balanced strategy:

‚ú®SAP for SAP semantics & real-time financial accuracy

‚ú®Snowflake/Databricks for massive non-SAP or AI workloads

‚ú®Unified enterprise definitions using BDC

‚ú®Shared KPI models across Finance, Sales, Supply Chain

This hybrid model delivers flexibility for IT and consistency for Finance.

 

üíéùóßùóµùó≤ ùóúùó∫ùóΩùóÆùó∞ùòÅ ùóºùóª ùóôùó∂ùóªùóÆùóªùó∞ùó≤ & ùóüùó≤ùóÆùó±ùó≤ùóøùòÄùóµùó∂ùóΩ ùóßùó≤ùóÆùó∫ùòÄ

Across every project, this structured approach delivers the same outcomes:

‚úî Finance teams get reconciled numbers they trust

‚úî FP&A gains a unified foundation for planning & forecasting

‚úî CFOs get a complete picture of profitability, cashflow & risk

‚úî CEOs get insights to drive strategy, not just reports

‚úî IT maintains a cleaner architecture with fewer custom interfaces

This is what modern finance transformation actually looks like.

 

üíéùóôùó∂ùóªùóÆùóπ ùóßùóµùóºùòÇùó¥ùóµùòÅ

üî∏SAP S/4HANA is the operational core.

üî∏A hybrid data fabric is the intelligence layer.

üî∏Together, they deliver reporting that is accurate, consistent, and decision-ready.

entry.title: 01 SAP SuccessFactors HCM Implementation - Phase 0 Objectives
entry.content:
This blog will focus on SAP SuccessFactors HCM Implementation - Phase 0 Objectives. 

This will be a multi-part series covering each topic in detail in the SAP SuccessFactors HCM implementation. The content is based on my experience leading multiple large-scale SAP SuccessFactors HCM Implementation projects over the past 10+ years.

Why are you doing Phase 0? 

Phase 0 in SAP SuccessFactorsHCM is the critical pre-implementation groundwork, a strategic readiness phase before the formal project implementation kickoff, focusing on business alignment, scope definition, data assessment, and implementation strategy (Transformation or As-is) to ensure project success, reduce risk, and build the business case. It's about defining what you're doing and why, aligning stakeholders, assessing current systems, and planning the Integration, data migration, and change management needed for a smooth transition to SuccessFactors HCM.

Phase 0 Objectives:

The list below covers the broader topics we handle in phase 0. It may vary by customer, but the objective is to ensure a clear strategy, ownership, and solution appropriate in place. 

Phase 0 Objectives Description and Responsibility Matrix:

Commonly asked questions on Phase 0 SAP SuccessFactors HCM:

Question 1: Is Phase 0 mandatory?

Answer: Phase 0 is not mandatory, but for complex transformation projects involving multiple countries, it is strongly recommended.

Question 2: Is Phase 0 Part of the implementation? 

Answer: Yes and NO. Some customers prefer to do so outside of implementation to scope the project correctly (Budget, Timelines, Deployment approach). Some customers choose to do it as part of the implementation. In both cases, the outcome is to achieve the objectives listed above. 

Question 3: Who leads Phase 0? 

Customer leads Phase 0, and the Implementation Partner (SI) brings SMEs. Some objectives are owned entirely by the customer, some are SI, and some are shared. 

Question 4: What is the format of  Phase 0 Deliverables? 

  1. Deliver Process Maps (Signavio, Lucidchart, Miro, etc.) for business process design.
  2. PPT - for Strategy documents
  3. Word document for detailed solution documents

Question 5: Does Phase 0 involve configuration work? 

Typically, no, but it depends on the phase duration. Sometimes, we can do an Iteration 0 configuration, which always helps. 

Question 6: What is the role of the customer in Phase 0?

The Customer Team (Business and IT) owns Phase 0 and ensures its objectives are achieved.

Question 7: What is the role of the SI in Phase 0?

Assist the customer in defining the deployment strategy, and provide expert-level advisory on business process design and solution design for the future state. Align customer goals and bring the right people with experience in similar projects.

entry.title: HANA Replication
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We are planning to upgrade the memory of our existing PERSON_NAME appliance and aim to minimize downtime throughout the process.

Currently, the HANA Database System Replication is configured from the Primary Node to the Secondary Node using Log Replay, and from the Secondary Node to the Tertiary Node. The upgrade strategy involves failing over from the Primary to the Secondary Node and upgrading the Primary Node first. During the upgrade, replication will continue with the Tertiary Node. After the upgrade is completed, we will initiate replication from the Secondary Node back to the Primary Node, establishing multi-node replication. Once replication is active, we will fail back to the Primary Node and reconfigure replication from the Primary to the Secondary and from the Primary to the Tertiary Node for multi-node replication. After replication is established, we will perform the Secondary Node memory upgrade, aiming to ensure continuous business operations with the Tertiary Node as a safeguard. Due to limited bandwidth, we do not want to maintain a full replica between the Primary Node and the Tertiary Node.

Please help us understand how to avoid a full replica rebuild when replication switches from the primary node to the tertiary node. Additionally, let us know how we can ensure that, during replication initialization, it will start with either a full replica or a delta update.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: HANA Replication
entry.content:
Hi,

Similar to the steps involved in updating the HANA version, you can use system replication to minimise downtime 

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_HANA_PLATFORM/4e9b18c116aa42fc84c7dbfd02111aba/ee3fd9a0c2e74733a74e4ad140fde60b.html

Regarding the full sync, you are starting off with multi-tier system replication and then changing to multi-target when you register Dr to primary instead of secondary.
That is fine but will involve a full sync of DR as it takes the data from primary to dr 
The persistence of DR will be incompatible with primary and it wont be able to just sync the delta as it was registered to secondary previously and now is being registered to the primary.

entry.title: How can we review costing variants (PYR1 actual costing) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public (Grow 2508)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are currently facing some issues in the production costing process in our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Grow, release 2508) system. The actual costs calculated for production orders appear incorrect, and as part of our analysis we are trying to verify every component that may influence the costing results.

During our review of production orders, we noticed that the system is using the actual costing variant PYR1 (and a planned costing variant as well). However, we have not been able to identify where in S/4HANA Cloud Public we can:

  • Display or review the definition of costing variants such as PYR1

  • Understand what parameters characterize this variant (valuation logic, costing type, date control, etc.)

  • Determine how these variants are assigned or used in production order costing

In SAP ECC, we used transaction OKKN to view costing variant configuration, but in S/4HANA Cloud Public, we cannot find an equivalent point‚Äînor an app or configuration area that displays these predefined variants or their logic.

Our main questions are:

  1. Where can we review the definition of costing variants such as PYR1 in S/4HANA Cloud Public?

  2. Are these costing variants predefined and not editable, or is there a recommended app or configuration view to understand how they work?

  3. Which apps, configuration steps, or documentation should we refer to in order to troubleshoot issues related to production costing (planned and actual)?

Any guidance or references from SAP experts or the community would be extremely helpful, as understanding the costing variant setup is key to diagnosing our current production costing issues.

Thank you very much for your support!

entry.title: Re: How to implement AI-assisted Scenarios in Cloud ERP Private and how to solve common problems
entry.content:
@MioYasutake Thanks for the comment.

There is an important word in your comment '...and often requires model training...' , I highlight this word because it is correct that not all use cases require training. The one I referred to in this blog does not - there is no Machine Learning happening on my data here. The fact that a training appears in the deployment section, is merely a means to an end to be able to activate the scenario.

With respect to your other question (and I feel is more a ML vs AI question) where data is needed to train a model, I would recommend that you always activate a scenario in a non production environment first, to take its through its paces, learn from it, tweak it...and first judge if it indeed does what you want it to, and then provide your users, in production, a really polished, valuable product that ensures adoption - not just because it makes sense but because:

  • Some use cases offer personalization possibilities (either by allowing prompting on custom entities, or leveraging a BADI to further tailor an interaction)
  • With Machine Learning scenarios - you can often tweak the importance and weighing of certain fields over others 

I do however take your point that all customers do not necessarily have a test environment with X years or Y volumes of data. If you have it in production, then refresh a test environment with it first. If you do not have the data, then wait until you do.

entry.title: Re: HRBP Value Not Nullified by SF User Connector Despite Blank Input
entry.content:
Hi @Tharun_madhira ,

Is this setting enabled? sfuser.connector.input.file.field.transformation.enable=true

Is the column HR_CONTACT empty in the file consumed by the connector?

If the above column is empty, the other settings (sfuser.field.mapping.data.HRBP=HR_CONTACT, sfuser.connector.updateOnNull=HRBP) seem correct. More details at the KBA 3512178 - updateOnNull and @NULLIFY@ Connector features - SAP for Me

Best regards,

entry.title: SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier shows ‚Äúinstance already exists‚Äù but no instance is visible
entry.content:
We are working in a Pay-As-You-Go SAP BTP partner account and initially created a test SAP CAP application connected to an SAP HANA Cloud database. After deleting this setup to start fresh, we encountered an HDI container‚Äìrelated error while creating a new CAP application. When checking the HANA Cloud section, no database instance was visible, but attempts to create a new HANA Cloud instance consistently fail with an error indicating that an instance already exists. We tried deleting and recreating the HANA Cloud service and even removed the entire subaccount, but the same error persists, suggesting a previously provisioned HANA instance is stuck or orphaned and still consuming quota, blocking further database setup.

Error:  BrokerError, Description: You may only create one SAP HANA Cloud Free Tier instance

Main Issue

While setting up a fresh SAP CAP application, I encountered an HDI container error. When checking SAP HANA Cloud, I noticed that no HANA Cloud instance was visible, even though the system behaves as if one already exists.

What I Tried (and Failed)

  • Create a new SAP HANA Cloud instance
    ‚Üí Failed with an error stating that only one instance is allowed (instance already exists)

  • Delete the HANA Cloud database and recreate everything
    ‚Üí Failed (same error persists)

  • Delete the entire SAP BTP subaccount and recreate everything
    ‚Üí Failed (same error still occurs)

Current Situation

It appears that an existing or orphaned HANA Cloud instance is still consuming quota, even though it is not visible or accessible, which is blocking further database setup and CAP development.

 

I would appreciate any guidance on how to clean up or reset this stuck SAP HANA Cloud instance so that we can proceed with database setup and continue CAP development.

entry.title: How to use Document Generation for Growth Portfolio Workflow Email Notifications
entry.content:
The Growth Portfolio in SAP SuccessFactors is rapidly becoming the central hub for employee capabilities, achievements, and development evidence. As more organizations adopt this feature, HR teams are looking for ways to bring structure, consistency, and governance into the associated workflows‚Äî especially when approvals or reviews are involved.

While the standard workflow notifications in SuccessFactors offer basic messaging and are more tailored towards Employee Central's event based messaging, customers want more personalised experience during skill validations in Growth Portfolio with richer formatting, dynamic tags, tailored guidance, localized content, and branding consistency. 

This is where Document Generation becomes a powerful, under-used enabler.

Why Use Document Generation for Workflow Notifications?

Although Document Generation is commonly associated with performance forms or employee documents, it also serves as a flexible tool for workflow-based communication. Using Document Generation templates, you can:

  • Craft highly formatted notification content
  • Insert dynamic placeholders (tokens) from employee data and workflow context
  • Provide tailored instructions for each step of the Growth Portfolio Validation Workflow
  • Add branding elements like logos, headings, and style profiles
  • Maintain versions and localization easily
  • Reduce manual follow-ups and inconsistencies

Document Generation essentially becomes your custom ‚Äúemail content designer‚Äù‚Äîwhile the workflow notification still handles the delivery.

Step for Configuring Custom Email Notifications Using Document Generation

Step 1: Enable Document Generation (if not already enabled)

In Admin Center, confirm that Document Generation is active and that you have permission to create and manage document templates.

Step 2: Go to Document Generation - Manage Document Template

  1. Click on Create New and select Document Generation Group
  2. Fill the basic details like Group Id and description about this template
  3. Now, click on Create New and select Document Generation Template

     

  4. This is the place where we would design our email templates' Subject and content
      • First fill up the basic details as shown below and tailor it as per the specific requirement like Template Id, Name, description, Category=Workflow, Language and assign the Workflow group created in above steps
      • Now update the email Subject and email Content as required, refer below screenshot

     

    • The tokens are highlighted in yellow within double square brackets [[token]], you can use standard tokens or create your own tokens using 'Insert Token' option as shown below. Also there are other options to customize the text, colour, hyperlink etc,

       

Step 3: Now we need to map values to the tokens

  1. Go to Document Generation - Manage Document Template Mapping and select respective Template created in Step 2 above.
  2. It will look like this, here we select different mapping type to assign values to our tokens in the email message

    1.  

  3. Now select the appropriate mapping as shown below dropdown

     

  4. Below are different set of values I have selected, like Employee token is mapped to show only First Name of employee and other values are referenced from Workflow context

Step 4: Now we need to assign the different such workflow email template to specific workflow action/step

  1. Go to Manage Workflow Email Configuration, and click Create, then it shows below screen 

     

  2. Now fill the code and Name and also keep only those notifications enabled which are required

     

  3. Now select the template created above instead of 'Standard template' where applicable, here we select it for Initiator (employee) to get a tailored email as per requirement when manager approves the proficiency change request in Growth Portfolio (GP)
  4. Select and save this configuration 

Step 5: Assign this Workflow Email Configuration to actual Manager workflow used in Growth Portfolio Validation business rule

  1. Go to Manage Organization, Pay and Job Structures, select Workflow - Manager
    Reference business rule to identify the Worklfow

     

  2. Now update the Workflow Email config (from Step 4) as below and save

Step 6: Test, employee changes skill proficiency and manager approves, then below custom email is received by employee instead of standard template

As you notice above, employee Aanya received the customised email notification post skill proficiency change approved by Manager. Email Subject and Content got changed and tokens pulled specific data as per mapping setup highlighted in yellow.

Approved Workflow request to see the comments posted by Approver using the hyperlink in email

Below is the standard template of Workflow Email Notification as configured in Email notification template settings > Workflow Step Approved Notification and how currently it appears for TIH > Growth Portfolio validation workflows.

So as we saw that SAP SuccessFactors‚Äô Document Generation tool is more than a document builder‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic communication engine. By integrating it into the Growth Portfolio Validation Workflow, organizations can deliver clearer, richer, and more personalized email notifications that guide users through every step of the process.

Hope this helps you to support customers further in their journey of becoming a skill based organisation and better manage employee skills.

Please let me know in comments how further we can use Document Generation to generate more contextualised workflow notifications. Happy to discuss!

PS: Link to my previous blog on how to setup workflow in Growth Portfolio can be checked here .

entry.title: Low Code/No-Code Capability (LCNC) support in SSAM
entry.content:
Overview

For a product like SAP Service and Asset Manager, adaptability is a core expectation, but it must be delivered in a controlled and maintainable way. The LCNC feature introduces a configurable layer within SSAM that enables customers to adjust field behavior, visibility, validation rules, and simple logic through metadata-driven settings rather than custom development. By supporting LCNC within its intended scope, SSAM reinforces its position as a flexible, enterprise-grade platform that can adapt to evolving business needs while maintaining architectural stability and performance.

Changes needed for LCNC

1. Backend Configuration to enable LCNC

In the Mobile Application Configuration section in Configuration Panel, set the parameter ‚Äòenable.metadata.parsing‚Äô under the LCNC parameter group to ‚ÄòY‚Äô and mark the parameter as Active. This enables LCNC metadata processing in SSAM.

2. Additional Business Fields using OData Properties

SAP Service and Asset Manager allows you to expose additional business fields on the mobile detail screens by enabling properties from the underlying OData entity sets. These properties, including both standard SAP fields and custom Z-fields, can be configured in the backend without changing the standard metadata. Once enabled, they appear on the mobile client as separate lines within the detail view, giving users more relevant information.

2.1 Changing existing SAP delivered fields through LCNC

You can expose standard SAP properties that already exist in the OData entity sets but are not shown by default on the mobile detail or list screens. Enabling fields like Priority and Main Work Center gives technicians quick visibility into urgency and ownership information without navigating through multiple screens.

The following examples show how LCNC makes these fields available on the mobile app.

In the Configuration Panel, go to 'OData Model Configuration' and select 'MyWorkOrderHeader'. Navigate to the Property List tab, choose the 'Priority field, switch to Edit mode, and enable the 'Extension' options. We can also define attributes like 'Custom Label', 'Visible in List Screen', 'Visible in Detail Screen' and 'Searchable'.

Repeat the same steps for MainWorkCenter property in MyWorkOrderHeader.

Now after saving these changes and performing a clean sync in SSAM client, the Work Order List screen displays both ‚ÄòCustom Main WorkCenter‚Äô and ‚ÄòCustom Priority‚Äô.

 

Now go to WorkOrder detail screen and scroll down to the Details section to see that Custom WorkCenter and Custom Priority are displayed.

2.2 Adding custom Z-fields

If your backend includes custom Z-fields, SSAM can display them on the mobile client by enabling them in the OData model configuration.

Let us enable LCNC for an existing ZProperty called  ZAisaProperty and assign it a Custom label Aisa_lcnc_property. In this example we make the field 'Visible in the Detail Screen' and mark it as 'Searchable'

Now save these changes and perform a clean sync and you will see the updated Work Order List Screen. Next let us pick an order which is moved to Hold State (WO#  4021881) after making this change. This WO detail screen which will display ‚ÄòChanged By‚Äô field.

After status change, from WO list screen, locate the WO.

Now select the WO 4021881 to go to the WO Details screen. Scroll down to Details section and you can see Aisa_lcnc_property displayed.

entry.title: Unlocking the NPP: Payments overview
entry.content:
Welcome to the second installment of the Blog series on the New Payments Platform (‚ÄúNPP‚Äù) in Australia.

The series is planned as:

  1. Unlocking the NPP: SAP Capabilities for Faster, Smarter Payments
  2. Unlocking the NPP: Payments overview
  3. Unlocking the NPP: PayID
  4. Unlocking the NPP: PayTo

In the previous Blog we described the capabilities of the NPP and provided a brief insight into how SAP delivers these.

In this Blog we‚Äôre going to dive into some of the details around file formats and Bank integration as these underpin the process. As mentioned in the previous Blog, each Bank defines their file format and contents so you will need to check these when building your specific solution.

 

Payment Format basics

I‚Äôm going to assume a working knowledge of SAP Payment processes, formats and integration but some of the terminology warrants further explanation.

NPP is built around files or messages (and I‚Äôll use the terms interchangeably) based upon ISO20022 which is:

‚ÄúA single standardisation approach (methodology, process, repository) to be used by all financial standards initiatives‚Äù and ‚Äúa multi part International Standard prepared by ISO Technical Committee TC68 Financial Services. It describes a common platform for the development of messages‚Äù.

https://www.iso20022.org/

For our purposes we just need to understand that ISO20022 defines numerous message types and their formats. The main message types SAP will be creating are the Payment Initiation (‚Äúpain‚Äù) formats:

  • pain.001 Customer Credit Transfer Initiation
    • this is the typical outgoing payment bank transfer
    • includes payments to BSB / Bank Account and to PayID (OSKO ID)
    • also support Direct Debits with PayTo Agreement
    • latest version V12 ‚Äì pain.001.001.12
  • pain.008 Customer Direct Debit Initiation
    • this is the request to collect from a Customer‚Äôs bank account
    • includes collections from BSB / Bank Account and with PayTo Agreement
    • latest version V11 ‚Äì pain.008.001.11

 

SAP standard content

So what does this mean in SAP? We maintain payment file formats in the Data Medium Exchange Engine  ‚Äì in SAP ECC this is transaction DMEE, in S/4HANA we have DMEEX (Extended) whilst in Public Cloud we use app ‚ÄúCreate Payment Medium Formats‚Äù. I‚Äôm not going to discuss the older RFFO* programs which required ABAP coding to manage the formats.

The payment file formats manage the file structure (header and item levels, field names and definitions etc) and the field contents. Contents can be hardcoded, mapped from SAP Payment structures (FPAY* tables) or flexibly derived through coding.

The ISO formats are delivered by SAP with a prefix CGI (Common Global Implementation) and you should see these in your S/4HANA system:

  • AU_CGI_XML_CT CGI                 Credit Transfer for Australia
    • This equates to the pain.001 format
  • AU_CGI_XML_DD CGI                Direct Debit for Australia
    • This equates to the pain.008 format

You may wonder why there is an Australian version of a global standard. One example is the use of the combination of BSB and Account number to manage Bank details for Payer and Payee, rather than just a single identifier such as an IBAN.

The latest published ISO pain.001 files version is 012 whilst the delivered SAP S/4HANA content is version 006. We are investigating when and how to release updated content for all file types. This is not an urgent requirement as Banks and NPP do not adopt the latest version immediately on release and updates can be configured as required.

In addition to the Australian versions of the ISO format, there are some generic formats delivered which may be useful as a reference:

  • S/4HANA
    • CGI_CT                CGI Credit Transfer
    • CGI_DD               CGI Direct Debit (Automatic Debit)
  • ECC (including Success Factors Employee Central Payroll)
    • CGI_XML_CT
    • CGI_XML_DD

 

Versions and Bank formats

In the previous Blog we described how SAP interacts with Banks who are connected to the NPP.

 

The Payer‚Äôs SAP system will create a payment file in the format required by the Bank. This may be in older ISO format (or variant) or another format.

The Bank validates this within their internal system and creates a pacs.008 Customer Credit Transfer ‚Äì Clearing Request which is sent to the NPP to make the payment.

A quick review of the Big 4 Banks‚Äô publicly available information on file format and mapping shows:

  • 2 mention pain.001 version 03
  • 1 mention ABA / DE (BECS) format
  • 1 has no specific NPP information

Just sending a pain.001 ISO format file to the Bank does not automatically mean that it will be processed through the NPP rather than BECS. Each Bank may use different fields in the file to determine the processing channel (i.e. NPP or BECS) and these may entail use of existing ‚Äúproprietary‚Äù (customer defined) fields. Banks can receive other formats, including NPP specific fields such as PayID (OSKO) and map the contents internally prior to sending to the NPP

The upshot of all this is that each SAP Customer will need to check with their Bank on formats, field content and data mapping to ensure files are processed correctly. Whilst there is a perception that everyone needs to move onto ISO20022 formats in readiness for the 2030 shutdown of the BECS clearing system, the timeframe is dictated by the Banks who determine their required format. 

As mentioned in the previous Blog, SAP‚Äôs strategic direction is to provide solutions based on common standards but not the Bank specific variations. Customers will therefore always require some additional customization to adjust the delivered standard content.

 

SAP Bank Integration

NPP does not require any specific changes to Bank integration and the typical legacy point to point integration can be retained. However, SAP recommends Multi Bank Connectivity (‚ÄúMBC‚Äù) combined with as the future state for NPP.

MBC already provides benefits around a managed integration service with visibility and control of the payments files. In the context of NPP it‚Äôs worth bearing in mind that the volume and frequency of ‚Äútraffic‚Äù to and from the Bank is likely to increase. Each Payment Header and Item will trigger three incoming messages (File accepted, Pending and Transaction Processed / Rejected). Customers may change the frequency of outgoing payments, for example moving from a batch driven weekly run to daily or even real-time activity. With the NPP operating 365 days a year, payments can be scheduled on weekends or Public Holidays. This allows payments exactly according to payment terms (but not early), enabling access to settlement discounts and improving cash flow. 

Similarly Incoming payments are usually only visible in the Bank Statement received the following day. As customers move to NPP for incoming payments and want to adopt flexible business models, such as processing sales or deliveries on receipt of funds, there is a requirement to handle real time incoming payment messages or intraday bank statements.

The combination of MBC and BCM provides a solution for bank integration suited to both real time processes and detailed logging of the inbound and outbound flows, as well as monitoring the status of payments and resolving errors.

MBC Member Banks can offer their APIs to SAP customers, enabling enhanced real-time capabilities while maintaining the security and reliability of the SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity platform. Some of the additional capabilities of the NPP such as PayTo Agreements (as the successor for Direct Debits) assume usage of APIs and sample files and flows are available from Australian Payments Plus (as the owner of NPP) as well as from Banks. Where a customer implements an API outside of MBC, they are responsible for all aspects of build and operation, including middleware, encryption and monitoring.

 

NPP payments ‚Äì the basics

Let‚Äôs assume we are working with a Bank which requires the pain.001 Version 003 file with a couple of specific field mappings.

Firstly, you should create the Bank specific version as a Child Tree of the standard format in DMEEX.

 

This new Format can be edited as required to meet the Bank specific Version, Format and Mapping details.

For example, the Bank requires ‚Äú<PmtMtd>‚Äù as ‚ÄúTRF‚Äù and ‚ÄúPmtTpInf><LclInstrm><Prtry>‚Äù as ‚ÄúX2PI‚Äù for a file to be processed with NPP (OSKO). This can be achieved with simple use of Constant in the DMEEX configuration.

Other mapping is possible with an understanding of how the information flows into the standard Payment file structures ‚Äì refer this Blog and related note:

Source of Information for Field in structures FPAYH-FPAYHX-FPAYP

Further flexibility is possible using BAdI FBL_EVENT_06 which enables population of ZREF01-ZREF10 fields which can then be mapped to the DMEE fields.

The Payment Format needs to be assigned to the Payment Method in "Set up Payment Methods for Each Country/Region for Payment Transactions" configuration.

 


You may consider defining new NPP specific Payment Methods. This is not mandatory but does provide a clear way to execute separate Payment Runs and Payment Files for BECS and NPP. For some Banks, the Payment Channel (NPP or BECS) is defined at the File header level.

You are also able to define whether the Payment Method can continue to work with BSB and Bank Account numbers from the Business Partner master or if PayID details are required (see next Blog).

The Payment Run execution, Payment File creation and transfer to the Bank follows the existing processes.

 

Incoming messages for payments

The Bank will send three status confirmation messages using the pain.002 format. How these are handled depends on your setup:

  • SAP BCM enables receipt and reporting of the incoming messages. This has integration back to the original payments and enables error handling through the reversal of the outgoing payment document and reset of open items, allowing a new payment to be created.
  • SAP MBC provides message viewing and forwarding capabilities
  • Custom built solution to store and view files as part of custom bank integration
  • No SAP solution, with potential to view in Bank portal

entry.title: Why does SAP always use Periodic Unit Price for valuation when Price Control = V (MAP)?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a question regarding standard SAP behavior for material valuation.

Material setup in my system (MM01 -> tab Accounting 1):

  • Price Control: V (Moving Average Price)
  • Price Determination: Transaction-Based

In this setup, I observed that SAP always uses the Periodic Unit Price as the valuation basis, and it never takes the Standard Price for price calculation.

My questions are:

  1. Why does SAP, for Price Control V, always refer to the Periodic Unit Price and not to the Standard Price?
  2. Is this behavior standard SAP design (hard-coded) or influenced by configuration?
  3. In standard SAP, what is the functional role of Standard Price when Price Control = V? 
  4. Is there any SAP documentation or program logic where this valuation behavior can be confirmed?

From a business perspective, we would like to understand why Standard Price cannot be used as the valuation base under Price Control V and whether this separation is intentional by SAP design.

Any clarification or references would be highly appreciated.

Best regards,
Ester Wang

entry.title: TCODEÔºöIDCNACCTBLN , debit & credit problem
entry.content:

entry.title: Basis support for CPM solution deployment in conjunction with BW activations
entry.content:
This section describes the implementation sequence for Project Workspace, Project Cost and Revenue Planning, and Project Issue and Change Management.

While there are many other functional tasks carried out by CPM consultant, here in this blog we will concentrate only on the tasks which require attention from platform/basis side. While we have many CPM business functions to be activated fot CPM functionality to work, lets deep dive into the required activities one by one.

The Release Information Note (SAP Note 3089817) contains important information and references related to Commercial Project Management. Based on your business needs, you can choose one of the following component combinations as a deployment option:

Here we are going with option1 as it includes everything we need for CPM to work.

  1. Activate the /CPD/CA_CPD_PWS_1 business function (see transaction SFW5 Enterprise Business Functions/CPD/CA_CPD_PWS_1).
  2. Activate the /CPD/CA_CPD_PFP_1 business function (see transaction SFW5 Enterprise Business Functions/CPD/CA_CPD_PFP_1).
  3. Activate the /PICM/CA_CPD_PICM_1 business function (see transaction SFW5 Enterprise Business Functions/PICM/CA_CPD_PICM_1).
  4. Install NWBC for Desktop (optional)
  5. If you wish to use workbooks as the front-end, install Analysis Office (see SAP note 3089817).
  6. Enable Planning Application Kit (PAK). PAK allows you to use the workbooks of SAP BusinessObjects Analysis, edition for Microsoft Office as part of the Commercial Project Management content.
  7. Enable delivery customizing in the relevant clients(Steps described below)
  8. Activate required SICF services
  9. Import the BRF+ customizing.
  10. BW activations

Let‚Äôs perform these activations one by one as depicted below.

  1. Activate the /CPD/CA_CPD_PWS_1 business function (see transaction SFW5 Enterprise Business Functions/CPD/CA_CPD_PWS_1).

 

 

 

Check for the above job‚Äôs completion in Sm37

2. Activate the /CPD/CA_CPD_PFP_1 business function (see transaction SFW5 Enterprise Business Functions/CPD/CA_CPD_PFP_1).

Follow the same steps as above for all of the BFactivations.

After activation, below is the status of business function

3. Activate the /PICM/CA_CPD_PICM_1 business function (see transaction SFW5 Enterprise Business Functions/PICM/CA_CPD_PICM_1).

Activate the below. Follow the above steps.

 

4. Install NWBC for Desktop (optional).

5. If you wish to use workbooks as the front-end, install Analysis Office (see SAP note 3089817) ‚Äì This is also optiona

6. Enable Planning Application Kit (PAK).

Procedure:

1.Get the latest information posted in SAP note 1637199.

2.In the back-end system, launch table/view maintenance (transaction SM30).

3.Enter RSPLS_HDB_ACT in the table/view field and choose Maintain.

4.Choose New Entries.

5.In the HANA Integratn. Active column, select Deep HANA Integration Active; and in the Functn. Active column, select the checkbox.

7. Enable delivery customizing in the relevant clients.

Please follow the below steps thoroughly for activation. Remember to execute these tasks in every production client we have in the system else few of the CPM functionalities will not work as expected.

1.Go to transaction SFW_BROWSER.

2.Expand the business function /CPD/CA_CPD_PWS_1.

3.Double-click on switch /CPD/CA_CPD_SFWS_PWS_1 to implement BC set activation.

4.Choose the Activate Dependent BC Sets button.

5.In the dialog box, select Activate Switch BC Sets and choose Continue.

6.In the next dialog box, select the following:

    1.Only Logon client for Cascading BC Sets

    2.Activate in logon client for Non-Cascading BC sets

    3.Activate for Cross-Client BC sets

    4.Select the checkboxes to ignore previous activations and ignore table delivery class for a new installation.

7.Repeat the BC set activation steps for the switch /CPD/CA_CPD_SFWS_PWS_S4_1.

8.Expand the business function /CPD/CA_CPD_PFP_1.

9.Repeat the BC set activation steps for the switch /CPD/CA_CPD_SFWS_PFP_1.

10.Expand the business function /PICM/CA_CPD_PICM_1.

11.Repeat the BC set activation steps for the switch /PICM/CA_CPD_SFWS_PICM_1.

 Below are the screens for the activation of /CPD/CA_CPD_PWS_1. Repeat the same steps for /CPD/CA_CPD_PFP_1 and /PICM/CA_CPD_PICM_1

 

 

 

 

 

8.  Activate required SICF services

1.Go to transaction SICF.

2.Choose Execute.

3.Go to default hostsapbcwebdynpro.

4.Ensure that all services under the cpd node are active.

5.Ensure that all services under the picm node are active

 

 

 

 

9. Import the BRF+ customizing application as follows.

  • Client 000

1.Run the report FDT_TRANS.

2.Provide the relevant customizing request.

3.Enter the object ID as 38EAA71741841EE59EFAD4B491883514.

4.Enter the object ID as F0D5105146757029E10000000A42852B.

5.Select the Transport Whole Application(s) radio button.

 

 

 

 

  • Productive Client

1.Launch the transaction SCC1.

2.Enter the source client as 000.

3.Provide the transport request in which you have transported the application (from client 000).

4.Select the Include Tasks in Requests checkbox.

5.Execute the transaction.

 

 

 

 

Transport Logs

 

10. BW activations

  1. Check on embedded BW client in the system. From basis standpoint, make sure an entry is defined in RSADMINA table for the BW Client.
  2. RSA1 connections should work for self connectivity and also for all backend connected systems.
  3. For BW specific tasks, please follow the BW guide for the steps. These have to be performed by BW consultant in conjunction with CPM consultant.

entry.title: Schedules for Maintenance Deliveries Transitioning to SAP for Me: A Smoother Experience
entry.content:
In 2022, we announced a significant change: The Schedules for Maintenance Deliveries would be moving to SAP for Me.  The transition to SAP for Me has sparked significant interest, with over 30,000+ blog views to date.

This indicates that you are highly interested in knowing when new products or updates will be available.  Over the past number of years, we have been listening to your feedback, striving to make this as seamless as possible for you.

We understand that transitions can be challenging, and your feedback has been invaluable in guiding improvements.  Here are some of the enhancements we have implemented based on your input:

  • Product-Specific Searching / Filtering: There is now an option to search for specific products in the search bar. You can see all current and future maintenance delivery events for a specific product along with past events in the drop-down list provided.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You can also select the filter icon where you have the option to display a specific product(s).  Here you can select the specific product(s) to display in the current calendar month.  You can then navigate through future months and show only those items.

  • Quarterly and Yearly View: There is now a quarterly and yearly view available under ‚ÄúMaintenance Deliveries‚Äù tab. Maintenance delivery events are listed under the relevant months in each quarter.  They can also be exported in ICS and Excel formats.

The Schedules for support package Stack and SAP BusinessObjects maintenance schedule will no longer be available after March 31st 2026. Users will fully transition to the SAP for Me Calendar.

Thank you for your patience and support during this transition. Your feedback is invaluable, and we encourage you to continue sharing your thoughts with us.

We hope these improvements will make things easier for you using the SAP for Me Calendar.

Kind regards,

Denise Reddy / Finbarr Ryan

SP Stack Strategy Leads

 

Further Resources

SAP for Me User Help

SAP for Me Community

SAP for Me Community Blog

entry.title: We are facing an issue with barcode scanning on a Honeywell CK65(hardware scanner) in an SAP MDK app
entry.content:
We are facing an issue with barcode scanning on a Honeywell CK65 (Android, hardware scanner) in an SAP MDK application.

Problem Summary

Our app has two places where scanning is used:

                  1. Search bar with ListPicker has "Search": { "Enabled": true, "BarcodeScanner": true } 

                      When scanning with CK65, the scanned value appears correctly inside the ListPicker search field.

    • MDK triggers barcode scan and the scanned value is populated in search field

    • 2. SimpleProperty :

      FormCell.SimpleProperty (MaterialInput)
      with:"AlternateInput": "Barcode",
      "ShowScanButton": true

      when using Honeywell CK65 hardware scanner, the scanned value does NOT populate in the SimpleProperty field.The same scanner works perfectly in the ListPicker search.


      Questions :

      1. Why does the Honeywell CK65 scan populate the ListPicker search field but NOT the SimpleProperty input, even though both open the same scanner UI?

        Thanks.

entry.title: Re: How can we review costing variants (PYR1 actual costi...
entry.content:
HI,

You can see the costing Variant definition in CBC configuration -

Accounting -> Inventory Accounting -> Business Role Templates Inventory Accounting  --> Define Costing Variants. Locate your variant and double click and see the details for Costing Type, valuation variant etc. This is for costing variant used for standard cost calculation. 

For Costing Variant used in Production order, you can find  in CBC

Manufacturing and Quality -> Preparation, Control, and Confirmation ->Discrete Manufacturing -> Shop Floor General for Discrete Manufacturing ->Define Order-Type-Dependent Parameters for Production Orders.

You can check the order type for the plant, double click, then go to costing

 

The settings are default and if you need the details of settings inside PYR1, please raise a request/Ticket to CBC team, they will provide you the information.

entry.content:
„ÅîÈÄ£Áµ°„ÅÑ„Åü„Å†„Åè„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÅÆÂÄ§„ÅÆË®≠ÂÆö„ÇÑÂ§âÊõ¥„Å™„Å©„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅ‰ΩúÊ•≠ÂäπÊûú„ÅåÂÆüÈöõ„ÅÆÊ•≠Âãô„ÉªÁí∞Â¢É„Å™„Å©„ÅÆÊßò„ÄÖ„Å™Êù°‰ª∂„Å´‰æùÂ≠ò„Åô„Çã„Åã„Å®ÊÄù„Çè„Çå„Åæ„Åô„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅ‰∫ãÂâç„Å´‰∫àÊÉ≥„Åó„Åã„Å≠„Çã„Å®ÊÄù„Çè„Çå„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

ÁâπÊÆä„Å™ÁêÜÁî±Ôºà‰æã„Åà„Å∞„ÄÅSAPÈñãÁô∫„Åã„Çâ‰æùÈ†º„Åå„ÅÇ„ÇãÔºâ„Åå„Å™„ÅÑÂ†¥Âêà„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„Çâ„ÅÆ„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÇíÂºäÁ§æÊé®Â•®ÂÄ§„ÅßË®≠ÂÆö„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„Å†„Åë„Çå„Å∞„Å®Â≠ò„Åò„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„ÅÆÊ©üËÉΩË™¨Êòé„ÉªÊé®Â•®ÂÄ§„ÅÆË©≥Á¥∞„Å´„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅ‰∏ãË®ò„ÅÆ„Éé„Éº„Éà„Çí„ÅîÂèÇÁÖß„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ„ÄÇ

„Éª„Éé„Éº„Éà

2222250 - FAQ: SAP HANA Workload Management
-> indexserver.ini -> [metadata] -> max_num_recompile_threads

==>
This parameter controls the number of threads that can be used for metadata recompilation. It can be particularly high if an object with a lot of dependencies is recompiled. The related thread method is ContinuousRecompileJobNode<id> (SAP Note 2114710). Reducing this setting can be a workaround for crashes (SAP Note 2664814) and timeout (SAP Note 2678230).

Starting with SAP HANA 2.0 SPS 08 the parallelism is limited by the default_statement_concurrency_limit parameter. For earlier Revision levels SAP recommends to manually lower the parameter (SAP Note 2600030).
===

1999998 - FAQ: SAP HANA Lock Analysis
-> indexserver.ini -> [metadata] -> max_num_recompile_threads

==>
This lock manages the latest commit timestamp of some metadata objects. Contention can be observed in context of recompilation of dependent objects when the base object is changed (thread method ContinuousRecompileJobNode<id>, SAP Note 2114710). The contention is typically local to the transaction changing the base object, so a temporary lock spike is acceptable. Contention mainly happens when a base object has many dependent objects. You can use SQL: "HANA_Objects_DependentObjects" (SAP Note 1969700) to determine dependent objects for a base object.

You can adjust the parallelity of recompilation using the following workload parameter (SAP Note 2222250):

indexserver.ini -> [metadata] -> max_num_recompile_threads
===

2800055 - FAQ: SAP HANA Kernel Sentinel
-> indexserver.ini -> [transaction] -> suspended_cursor_lifetime

==>
Runtime threshold for suspended cursor termination

An active statement (as found in M_ACTIVE_STATEMENTS) is considered, when its status is SUSPENDED and the time since LAST_EXECUTED_TIME exceeds suspended_cursor_lifetime. Thus, a termination is possible even if the statement is in SUSPENDED state only for a short time (i.e. LAST_ACTION_TIME is fairly recent), as long as the overall runtime exceeds the limit.

A value of 0 prevents terminations.

For ABAP systems it is recommended to increase the parameter to 1440 - 14400 minutes (1 - 10 days) to avoid unexpected terminations. See SAP Note 2600030 for more details.

See Is there a way to flexibly tackle garbage collection issues depending on existing memory pressure? for additional dynamic mechanisms.
===

As you move forward in your implementation journey with SuccessFactors, it's time to focus on enablement and preparing for a successful go-live. In this session, our experts will guide you through key enablement strategies, essential system validations, and final readiness steps to ensure a smooth deployment. Whether you're finalizing configurations or training your teams, this webinar will provide actionable insights to help you become empowered and deliver a successful go live.

Key Agenda Items:

  • Enablement Overview ‚Äì A comprehensive guide to training resources by role
  • Best practices and Implementation guidance overview
  • Continuous Quality Check (CQC) resources and readiness checks
  • Go Live Kit and how to access Release information
  • Live Q&A with our experts Join us to gain the knowledge and resources needed for a successful and seamless go-live!

 Please contact SAP_SuccessFactors_Onboarding@sap.com for any questions on this event.

entry.title: The effective period of the quota agreement cannot be changed
entry.content:
Why the effective period of some quota agreements cannot be changed.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: The effective period of the quota agreement cannot be...
entry.content:
Editing existing validity periods (if allocated/base quantity is filled in) is not available with the Fiori App Manage Quota Arrangement.

  1. In case of Base Quantity only, possible to clear the base quantity and the validity will be editable again.
  2. In case of Allocated Quantity, it is not possible to change the valid to date in the existing quota since it has been used in documents like PR, PO. Please create a new Quota Arrangement Item for the new supplier in existing Quota.
  3. If there is a new supplier valid for an extended period more than the original Quota Arrangement, it is advised to create a new Quota arrangement for that validity period and supplier.
